meanings.definition: Vulgar or obscene in a way that is sexually explicit.
meanings.sent1: The movie had a raunch scene that made some people uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: She found the comedian's raunch jokes to be inappropriate for a family audience.
meanings.sent3: The party had a raunch theme, but it was all in good fun.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the wall was a raunch display of explicit content.
meanings.sent5: The novel described the raunch encounter in vivid detail.

meanings.definition: To behave in a vulgar or obscene manner.
meanings.sent1: He tends to raunch around when he's had too much to drink.
meanings.sent2: The comedian decided to raunch up his act for the late-night show.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought it was funny to raunch at each other during recess.
meanings.sent4: She didn't want to raunch in front of her grandparents.
meanings.sent5: The group of teenagers continued to raunch despite the warnings.

meanings.definition: A vulgar or obscene quality or characteristic.
meanings.sent1: The movie had a raunch that some viewers found distasteful.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand the raunch in the music video.
meanings.sent3: The party had a hint of raunch that added excitement to the atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The comedian's performance was full of raunch that divided the audience.
meanings.sent5: The book's cover art hinted at the raunch inside.
